quoteFirst: The building artificers having landed at
quoteLast: to-day, 16 stones were laid, when they again left the Rock at a quarter past 4, having been four hours at work. The weather having a very unfavourable appearance, the landing-master expressed a wish to bring all hands with him; but the Joiners’ squad, with Mr Fortune their cook, had now resolved to continue their quarters on the Beacon-house, instead of having “the continual plague of boating;” and being now better provided with necessaries, they felt much more at ease.
title:
An Account of the Bell Rock Light-House

quoteLast: you will be heard that lesson. At a quarter-past twelve you will attend a lecture on English literature, which will last till one o’clock. quoteFirst: “Nothing! nothing!” she said. Then she went up again in despair. About
quoteLast: , she cried out: “Here he is! I hear the horse!” Again she went down, followed by the man who went to open the iron gate of the courtyard. “It is strange,” she said, “that he should return by the Conches woods!”
